text: Scientific studies have shown that walking, besides its physical benefits, is also beneficial for the mind, improving memory skills, learning ability, concentration and abstract reasoning, as well as reducing stress and lifting spirits.
author: Wikipedia

text: The oldest known creature to have lived on land is Pneumodesmus newmani. It lived 428 million years ago.
author: Wikipedia

text: There are several theories of the adaptation value of bipedalism. It is possible that bipedalism was favored because it freed up the hands for reaching and carrying food and saved energy during locomotion.
author: Wikipedia

text: A new study provides support for the hypothesis that walking on two legs, or bipedalism, evolved because it used less energy than quadrupedal knuckle-walking.
author: Wikipedia

text: The first known animal that walked on two legs is the bolosaurid Eudibamus whose fossils date from 290 million years ago.
author: Wikipedia

text: Mudskippers are amphibious fish that can walk on land. These fish use their fins to move around in a series of skips. They can also flip their muscular bodies to catapult themselves up to 60 cm into the air.
author: Wikipedia

text: The first spacewalk was performed by Alexey Leonov on March 18, 1965 and lasted 12 minutes outside Voskhod 2 spacecraft.
author: Wikipedia

text: The first walk on the lunar surface was performed by Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin on July 21, 1969. This Moon walk lasted 2 hours and 36 minutes.
author: Wikipedia

text: An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: My life is like a stroll upon the beach, As near the ocean's edge as I can go.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: As a single footstep will not make a path on the earth, so a single thought will not make a pathway in the mind. To make a deep physical path, we walk again and again. To make a deep mental path, we must think over and over the kind of thoughts we wish to dominate our lives.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
author: John Muir

text: I only went out for a walk and finally concluded to stay out till sundown, for going out, I found, was really going in.
author: John Muir

text: Going to the mountains is going home.
author: John Muir

text: Between every two pines is a doorway to a new world.
author: John Muir

text: Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I'm a slow walker, but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: A drawing is simply a line going for a walk.
author: Paul Klee

text: A vigorous five-mile walk will do more good for an unhappy but otherwise healthy adult than all the medicine and psychology in the world.
author: Paul Dudley White

text: Giant steps are what you take, Walking on the moon.
author: The Police

text: Take a walk with a turtle. And behold the world in pause.
author: Bruce Feiler

text: The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.
author: Joseph Joubert

text: We must walk consciously only part way toward our goal, and then leap in the dark to our success.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The truth depends on a walk around a lake.
author: Wallace Stevens

text: There is no certainty, there is only adventure.
author: Roberto Assagioli

text: Be careful going in search of adventure - it's ridiculously easy to find.
author: William Least Heat-Moon

text: This is one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.
author: Neil Armstrong

text: When someone is impatient and says, 'I haven't got all day,' I always wonder, How can that be? How can you not have all day?
author: George Carlin

text: Home is everything you can walk to.
author: Jerry Spinelli

text: It is good to have an end to journey toward, but it is the journey that matters in the end.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

text: Improvement makes strait roads, but the crooked roads without Improvement, are roads of Genius.
author: William Blake
